channel.title: DTong | Blog Talk Radio Feed
channel.description: The Only Sports Talk AND Music Show! DTong knows his sports and his music, with facts to back up analysis, his views and predictions are proven! Playing the hottest new independent artists/music and talkin sports, what can be better?! Every show has a featured Debate of the Day subject discussed in the chat room and call in number for live shows. Covering the important topics, not the nonsense! This is not your normal boring sports talk, THIS IS A SHOW! If you cant catch me live here on BTR, or catch me on the archives @ www.DTongSports.com ANY ARTISTS INTERESTED IN PLAYING YOUR SONG ON MY SHOW SEND ME YOUR MP3 OR AUDIO FILE W/ LINKS/WEBSITES or SEND ME A MESSAGE TO DTONGRADIO@LIVE.COM If you are interested in sponsoring the show or advertising on the show contact here: http://20ez.com/srv?sid=8368007690

item.description:
Brought to you by: www.100PercentWinners.com www.FirstCatchFishing.com www.HotLoveMakingTips.com www.BuzzHostingServices.com DTong has been on the air for 100 episodes now, and its only getting better and bigger! Thank you to all who support and share with the universe! In this 2 1/2 hour 100th show special DTong will be going over the NFL week 2, making week 3 picks, and going over fantasy and injury updates! College football Super-Conference talk, last weeks picks gloat, and this weeks top 25 matchups and picks! MLB in full swing and getting down to crunch time! item.description:
Brought to you by: Advantage RentACar Atlanta www.CustomCollegeFlags.com http://GridironExperts.com and... www.YourSmartPhoneGuy.com DTong welcomes special guest Grayson Boucher aka "The Professor", streetball legend, basketball extraordinare, and Ball Up streetball representative! item.title: DTong Sports Talk & Music Show - NBA & Life w/out the NFL - Apr 25,2011
item.description:
Sponsored by The BodyGuard by AntibodyWear.com DTong Sports will have alot to cover by this weeks show, especially in the NBA Playoffs! Are the Heat on track, can the Lakers 3peat, and are the Bulls still the best team in the NBA? Can the Celtics sweep the Knicks? Even though he hopes it doesnt happen, DTong will go over what American lives would be like w/ out the NFL! Hell present some interesting ideas and hypotheticals. Also, NHL hockey playoffs are heating up, going to go over each series real quick! MLB still early, but plenty going on to talk about! All that and of course the best independent music anywhere! New music from BREN, Jah Money ft JQP, Leah Hilton, South Coast Records presents Stupid Genius & Jay Fresko, a new Cave Boys track, and more! All artist submit your music to be played right here in front of thousands of listeners @ www.BlogTalkRadio.com/DTong or www.DTongSports.com See you @ the show!

item.description:
Sponsored my www.AntibodyWear.com and www.Less4Gas.ws NBA Playoffs in full swing and DTong will be breaking down each matchup East and West, game 1s were all close! item.title: Lebron vs Cle - Dec 02,2010
item.description:
So the day is finally here, the moment all the Cavs fans have obnoxiously been waiting for. The day where Lebron James of the Miami Heat comes into the Q Arena and voluntarily accepts all the boos and ungrateful remarks that will be definitely spit his way (from the losers of course). The legend you were hoping would bring the city of Cleveland out of crumbles in professional sports and who you rooted so hard for to bring you a championship. The same man who you all felt needed to be built around in order to create a dominant franchise, but never got the necessary players to accomodate his style. The best centers you can find this guy were Big Z, Verajao, and a used up limited minutes Shaq. You could have gotten Bosh and brought him to CLE, or at least a center who is like KG or Superman who is ready to run the floor and dominate in transition. I don't even want to start on point guards, would be a waste of my breath and carpal tunnel for typing it all. There are a million better options than Mo Williams and Delante West. As the NFL crew would say, "C'mon Man!".

Anyway, back to what he gave Clevelanders. A nice arena, a ton more fans, crazy revenue for the city of Akron and the boys and girls club and numerous other charities. He clothed you with the jerseys you bought, gave you something to cheer for, and never asked you for anything, just tried to do his best to win for "your" city.

You all are a true meaning of the word FANATIC! (Now, Im only talking to Cle fans that are Lebron Haters, not true Cleveland Fans). Instead of rooting for a man to do well in his life and be great at what he does, you take this "ownership" of him and think he should be your savior for the remaining days of your life! All you can do is root as fan, and the only little control you have is at a live game making noise for your team. Other than that, as a sports fan, you'll still watch him on TV, the Heat are drawing revenue that Cleveland has been taking advantage of for years! And where does the Cavs ownership get off making negative statements about Lebron for any reason???!!! Lebron created so much more for that team than you could have ever dreamed of and you should be thanking him after you kiss his toes a thousand times over.

Its sad as a society that this is how we can be. We care so much about a team in which we dedicate all of our emotion and time into supporting them, but as soon as something goes to the wayside; as in an individuals decision to do what he wants and not what you want, we can turn hate and dislike to that person because he is no longer one of "you". I see why other countries want to blow us up and infest terror on our nation. It's little things like this that you all worry about instead of being supportive of an individuals personal free decision and let him/her pursue thier own happiness. I truly believe that its because one of two things....1) You never actually played at a competitive level of sport in which you would appreciate an athletes talents, not just who he/she plays for, or 2) You are mad because you don't have a million people following your every move, every hour of the day, every day of the week, every week of the year for the rest of your life. You have no fans of your own so you have to hate on someone who does. Spill all of your negative energy onto the court Thursday night and a person like Lebron will take it and turn it into positive energy, you will have no affect on his game, so go ahead and waste your breath. Meanwhile, look around you while your at the game, or at the bar, or wherever your watching, because he is still selling out the Q and he doesn't even play for the team anymore. Your welcome Cleveland, you just might make the playoffs in the East with a .500 record with all the other "talent" they surrounded Lebron with. You never got him the superstar sidekick he needed, so he went and tried it on his own. From Cleveland to South Beach for a better team???? Who wouldn't. Im rooting for the Heat in this new fued!

Thank you for reading.

DTong-host-DTong Sports Talk AND Music Show

www.BlogTalkRadio.com/DTong



Lebron James | cleveland cavaliers | miami heat | nba | basketball | cleveland | miami | sports | dtong

item.title: Lakers vs Celtics - DTong's Breakdown for the 2010 NBA Finals - Jun 01,2010
item.description:
Alright, after its all said and done the two best teams throughout these 2010 playoffs were definitely the Lakers and Celtics.  Not just because they made it this far, but they really played consistently better than any other playoff team.  They both had to beat the best teams that the east and west had to offer, and they did it in their own way.  Lakers big men were way too much for the Suns and their shooting percentage was out the roof!! Orlando just got off to a bad start on the first three games and were playing catchup ever since, but to beat the Celtics four games in a row was completely unfathomable.   The Cavs disappointed but are still in the top 5 of NBA teams right now, without question.  The Spurs are a contender, but aging, and need a tune-up.  I dont think the Mavs have what it takes to reach let alone to win a championship,  and OKC will be in the mix for at least the next 5 years.

But enough about the losers, the Celtics and Lakers will face one another in the NBA Finals for the 12th time with Boston winning 9 of the last 11.  Its gonna be a great series no doubt, but I gotta pick the Lakers in 6 and here's why...

1) Kobe Bryant - Just like he did against the Suns, the man can take over a game by himself at any time he wants, and his shooting percentage is usually better than the rest of his team, so even if he shot it every time, the man is evidently capable of  81 points in a game, oh...he already did that? exactly.

2) Lakers Bench - They really havent had to come up big in these playoffs cuz the starting 5 are gettin it done, but thats why, they are healthy and ready to go when called upon.  Farmar can be a starting point guard on most teams and when he comes in he is just as big of a contributor as Fisher if not more with his driving capabilities.  Lamar Odom has let his game do the talking and will come close to a double-double every game, off the bench, and also provide some quality rest for Gasol and Bynum while maintaining the D.

3) Kobe Bryant - Not only his scoring but his defense should be enough to lock up Pierce or Allen, whichever Artest wont be on. 

4) Coaching - No offense to Doc Rivers but Phil Jackson is a basketball mastermind.  He will recognize what is working for the Celtics and take that away, and he also knows how to manage the playoffs games with his leadership. 

5) Kobe Bryant - its inevitable that the man will win his 5th NBA title and do everything he can in his power to make that a reality. 

I said it when the playoffs started but the LA LAkers WILL COME OUT AS THE 2010 nba champions!

NBA | basketball | lakers | celtics | sports | playoffs

Orlando just got off to a bad start on the first three games and were playing catchup ever since, but to beat the Celtics four games in a row was completely unfathomable.   The Cavs disappointed but are still in the top 5 of NBA teams right now, without question.  The Spurs are a contender, but aging, and need a tune-up.  I dont think the Mavs have what it takes to reach let alone to win a championship,  and OKC will be in the mix for at least the next 5 years.

But enough about the losers, the Celtics and Lakers will face one another in the NBA Finals for the 12th time with Boston winning 9 of the last 11.  Its gonna be a great series no doubt, but I gotta pick the Lakers in 6 and here's why...

1) Kobe Bryant - Just like he did against the Suns, the man can take over a game by himself at any time he wants, and his shooting percentage is usually better than the rest of his team, so even if he shot it every time, the man is evidently capable of  81 points in a game, oh...he already did that? exactly.

2) Lakers Bench - They really havent had to come up big in these playoffs cuz the starting 5 are gettin it done, but thats why, they are healthy and ready to go when called upon.  Farmar can be a starting point guard on most teams and when he comes in he is just as big of a contributor as Fisher if not more with his driving capabilities.  Lamar Odom has let his game do the talking and will come close to a double-double every game, off the bench, and also provide some quality rest for Gasol and Bynum while maintaining the D.

3) Kobe Bryant - Not only his scoring but his defense should be enough to lock up Pierce or Allen, whichever Artest wont be on. 

4) Coaching - No offense to Doc Rivers but Phil Jackson is a basketball mastermind.  He will recognize what is working for the Celtics and take that away, and he also knows how to manage the playoffs games with his leadership. 

5) Kobe Bryant - its inevitable that the man will win his 5th NBA title and do everything he can in his power to make that a reality. 

I said it when the playoffs started but the LA LAkers WILL COME OUT AS THE 2010 nba champions!

NBA | basketball | lakers | celtics | sports | playoffs

item.title: Sports and Society - Oct 27,2009
item.description:
Action sports in Atlanta has been going on for decades.  With the ecletic and diverse group of people the area has to offer, it's amazing how action sports can bring them all together in one arena. 
No matter what differences or issue they may carry outside in the real world, it all gets set aside for the love of sport.  Whether they are a true fanatic of the team, a dad just trying to take his family to a game, or a couple looking to get away from the kids for a night, action sports can bring a lot of positive energy into one nucleus of people cheering for the pride of their team!

All of the attention in the nucleus is focused on one thing, a win!  But, as you look around the stands, you see thousands of people rooting for the same thing.  They are like your brothers and sisters.  Despite you may never actually meet most of these individuals, you have that one thing in common and it makes you feel like a part of an exclusive group.

Action sports in America have been around for over a century, and can even be dated back to Roman times.  Sports have transceded issues through time and have had a huge impact on racism and discrimination.  Sports teaches you to be part of a team.  The goal is to win.  No matter where you came from or what you think, the win will never come if any part of that team focuses on anything else.  All black teams use to have to play all white teams, now you have African Americans, Caucasians, Hispanics, Asians, Pacific Islanders, Europeans, and every ethniticy imaginable playing action sports, many on elite levels and on the same team. 

It's not about race or culture anymore, it's about being part of a team to achieve a common goal.  From the player to the fan, the more people that come together, the easier that goal will be accomplished.

Dan Tong
